comments.creator: tonn81@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686 on x86_64; rv:2.0b10) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b10
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686 on x86_64; rv:2.0b10) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b10

I have a page that handles files dropped to it (see attachment).
When I drop files second time while first drop didn't finish yet - then these drop events become a mess.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Drop many files
2. Don't wait until they are handled
3. Drop another file
Actual Results:  
e.dataTransfer.files on the both events are being mixed

Expected Results:  
Each dataTransfer.files do not influence to each other and work like it was a single drop

comments.author: enndeakin@gmail.com
comments.creator: enndeakin@gmail.com
comments.text:
What do you mean 'when the first drop didn't finish yet'?

How do you drag/drop while another drop hasn't finished?
comments.raw_text:
What do you mean 'when the first drop didn't finish yet'?

How do you drag/drop while another drop hasn't finished?

comments.creator: tonn81@gmail.com
comments.text:
If many files are dropped - then it takes several seconds to process dropped files (to get e.dataTransfer.files). So I meant another drop while previous one didn't finish processing.

Please open testcase file - then it would be more obvious. That bug happens when I make another drop while log says 'New files drop' but 'Finished drop' is not shown.
comments.author: tonn81@gmail.com
